_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES
Constellation Wines has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the Black Grape Chillers, 550 Refrigeration, Neutralization and Sulfur Dioxide Systems.  Constellation Wines? policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

550 REFRIGERATION SYSTEM
The Refrigeration system is a Risk Management Program 3 (RMP). This process is a centralized ammonia compression refrigeration system consisting of four (4) 700 hp screw compressors, high pressure receiver, and one (1) low pressure liquid ammonia recirculation system. There are fourteen (14) shell & tube heat exchangers used for direct cooling of wine. 

NEUTRALIZATION SYSTEM
The Neutralization system is a RMP Program 3. Both the Neutralization and Ion Exchange systems utilize the anhydrous ammonia stored in a 11,897 gallon ASME Code Pressure Vessel. The Neutralization system uses anhydrous ammonia to neutralize sulfur dioxide emissions in an evaporative cooling water tower. The evaporative cooling water tower concentrates juice for processing. The cooling tower water is continuously monitored by an in line Ph analyzer. This analyzer signals a control valve that meters an appropriate amount of ammonia into the water to correct the Ph. The Ion Exchange system neutralizes the effect of sulfuric acid in the cation/anion demineralization beds. The cation/anion demineralization system is used to process product in th ewinery.

SULFUR DIOXIDE SYSTEM
The Sulfur Dioxide system is a RMP program 3. This process is the simple transfer of liquid anhydrous sulfur dioxide from a one-ton cylinder into smaller gauging cylinders. This process uses gravity assisted by inert gas counterpressure to provide the motive

force. The smaller cylinders are used for injecting and circulating sulfur dioxide into the wine to inhibit, and stop the fermentation process.

BLACK GRAPE CHILLERS
The Refrigeration system is a Risk Management Program 3 (RMP). This process is a centralized ammonia compression refrigeration system consisting of a screw compressors, high pressure receiver, and a low pressure liquid ammonia recirculation system. There are eight (8) shell & tube heat exchangers used for direct cooling of wine. 

HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY/OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS
Worst-Case Release Scenario Results Summary
Scenario Description: Per the EPA Regulations, one worst-case release scenario has been defined for each of the four systems.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.
  
Alternative Release Scenario Results Summary
Scenario Description: Per the EPA Regulations, one alternative-case release scenario has been defined for each of the four systems.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.  
RISK CONSIDERATIONS
Although the storage and use of anhydrous ammonia and sulfur dioxide has inherent potential risks and the release scenarios can potentially reach sensitive populations within the community, Constellation Wines has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs to make the worst case type of event non-credible.  In addition to the safety practices of the facility and personnel to make the worst-case event non-credible, it should also be recognized that there are inherent analysis assumptions that make the results of the atmospheric dispersion analysis appear worse than what would actually be expected during such an event.

In addition to the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associated with a anhydrous ammonia or sulfur dioxide release.  The facility also has safet

y systems in place to protect personnel such as PSVs, safety showers, respiratory equipment, and gas detection.


PREVENTION PROGRAM
As part of the implementation of RMP, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Constellation Wines to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia and sulfur dioxide. Prevention Program 3 elements include:

?68.65    Process Safety Information (PSI) 
?68.67    Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
?68.69 Operating Procedures (OP)
?68.71    Training (TRN)
?68.73    Mechanical Integrity (MI)
?68.75    Management of Change (MOC)
?68.77    Pre-Startup Review (PSSR)
?68.79    Compliance Audits (CA)
?68.81    Incident Investigation (II)
?68.83    Employee Participation (EP)
?68.85    Hot Work Permit (HWP)
?68.87    Contractors (CO)
?68.90    Emergency Planning & Response (EP&R)


FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no RMP-applicable releases of ammonia or sulfur dioxide at the facility in at least the past five (5) years.  
 
FLAMMABLES: WORST CASE
The use of flammable materials at Constellation Wines is not encompassed by the federal RMP requirements.  Therefore, this section is not applicable. 

FLAMMABLES: ALTERNATIVE RELEASE
The use of flammable materials at Constellation Wines is not encompassed by the federal RMP requirements.  Therefore, this section is not applicable.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 
Constellation Wines has implemented an Emergency Action Plan and does not assume the role of first responder during an emergency. Constellation Wines has filed a Chemical Inventory Business Plan with the Madera County Fire Department and this plan includes:
?    Emergency Alarm Procedures
?    Evacuation Procedures
?    Safety and Health Considerations
?    Notification Procedures

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Constellation Wines is extremely diligent in the handling of ammonia and sulfur dioxide. Planned changes to improve safety are listed as recommendations in the PHA Reports.
